Description: Sherd (two joining fragments) of shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery vessel, perhaps a krater; inside reserved; outside, cream slip; animal frieze to right; front part of lion with raised paw and much of a bull, head lowered; added red on bodies and necks; blob rosettes, some incised, as fill; band with added red band lined in white below; below, metopal frieze of rosettes and part of further band.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1130)
